title: Media Alert: Improving Lives Campaign Underway!
description: Improving Lives Campaign Features Series of Free Prostate Cancer Screenings for Tri-State Men in 2012
body:
Improving Lives Campaign Features Series of Free Prostate Cancer Screenings for Tri-State Men in 2012

The Urology Group Offers First Free Screenings April 2 in Sharonville

CINCINNATI (March 21, 2012) – The Urology Group will provide a series of free prostate screenings under a community outreach program dedicated to fighting prostate cancer. The goal of the campaign is to increase the percentage of local men getting tested and raise awareness about the benefit of early detection throughout the tri-state.

The Cincinnati area’s largest urological practice will conduct the first free screenings for men on April 2 from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. at the Sharonville Convention Center, 11355 Chester Road. The screenings coincide with the Baby Boomer/Senior Expo. The second free-screening event will be part of the Santa Maria Community Health Fair on April 15 from 12 p.m. to 3 p.m. The location is the Price Hill Recreation Center, 959 Hawthorne Ave.

The privately conducted screenings are a painless 5-10 minute process consisting of a simple blood test and a brief prostate exam. Health insurance is not required.

The Urology Group’s campaign will also feature a 5K Run/Walk for Prostate Cancer on Saturday, September 8, in Norwood. Community groups or other large organizations interested in partnering with The Urology Group on a free-screening event or to sponsor the 5K may email Prostate5KCincy@Theurologygroup.net.

“Early detection is critical to successfully treating prostate cancer. Urologists have seen a nearly 40% reduction in prostate cancer deaths since the mid-1990s when testing became commonplace for men over 50 and for higher risk men over 40,” said Dr. Gary M. Kirsh, President of The Urology Group. “The cure rate is extremely high when prostate cancer is detected early.”

According to the American Cancer Society about 1 man in 6 will be diagnosed with prostate cancer during his lifetime and more than 28,000 will die from the disease each year. Prostate cancer is the second leading cause of cancer death in American men, behind only lung cancer.

More information about the free prostate cancer screening campaign, including times and locations of additional screening events throughout the year, will be posted on www.freeprostatecincy.com.


 

About The Urology Group

The Urology Group is one of the largest single specialty groups of urologists in the United States, with 35 physicians on staff. The Urology Group provides medical and surgical care for all diseases of the urinary tract in men and women and the genital tract of men. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, and opening a $20 million advanced care surgery facility in the summer of 2012, the group includes practices extending from Northern Kentucky to Middletown, Ohio, and from Southeastern Indiana to Adams County, Ohio.

title: Urologists in Cancer Care: The Urology Group: Balancing Expansion With Commitment to the Community
description: OncLive's Urologists in Cancer Care features The Urology Group in its June issue.
body:
The week that Urologists in Cancer Care was scheduled to speak with members of The Urology Group in Cincinnati, Ohio was a hectic one. The American Urological Association (AUA) had just wrapped up its annual meeting, and urologists were contending with some bad news: The US Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) confirmed its recommendation against routine prostate cancer screening with prostate-specific antigen (PSA) testing.

Read more

title: Cincinnati Enquirer: Urology Group poised for growth
description: The Urology Group is poised to expand its already substantial reach.
body:
The Urology Group is poised to expand its already substantial reach with the impending opening of a $20-million, 55,000-square-foot headquarters that includes a $3.2 million investment in high-tech equipment from Siemens.

The Norwood-based business is among the largest independent groups of its kind in the country with more than 300 employees – including 35 physicians – and 13,000 cases handled annually at 19 locations. President Dr. Gary Kirsh estimates the group handles roughly 75 percent of services in its footprint, which stretches south to Lexington, west to Batesville, Ind., north to Middletown and east to Adams County.

It also expects to bring on additional employees.

See coverage

On Friday, the anchors, John Lomax (WKRC – Local 12), Rob Williams (WXIX – Fox 19), Todd Dykes (WLWT – News 5) and Brian Yocono (WCPO – 9 On Your Side), came together for a photo shoot and PSA taping to promote the race and prostate cancer awareness.

title: Yahoo! Health - Are Bidets Healthier Than Toilet Paper?
description: Dr. Philip Buffington contributed to this Yahoo! Health piece on the pros and cons of using bidets:
body:
Dr. Philip Buffington contributed to this Yahoo! Health piece on the pros and cons of using bidets:

While Philip Buffington, MD, chief medical officer at The Urology Group, says that using a bidet provides better personal hygiene, he’s quick to note that it is possible to have too much of a good thing. Sometimes it’s better to be a little less clean by using toilet paper. “You need some bacteria,” he says. “Cleaning too frequently can disrupt some of this good bacteria.”

READ FULL ARTICLE HERE.

description: Dr. Gary Kirsh talks about new approaches in advanced prostate cancer care.
body: Dr. Gary Kirsh talks about new approaches in advanced prostate cancer care. The Urology Group has developed a clinical approach that better connects patients with physicians and treatments specifically designed to treat advanced stages of the disease.

description: Kate Winslet talks about urinary leakage--Dr. Buffington provides commentary.

Actress Kate Winslet opens up about an issue many women face after having children--incontinence. Dr. Philip Buffington is quoted about the issue in this article. 

Read full article

title: ONCLive - Data - The New Currency in Healthcare Improvement

body:
Dr. Gary Kirsh, President of The Urology Group and of the Large Urology Group Practice Association (LUGPA) is part of a panel discussion on improving patient care. Physician groups recognize the opportunity to leverage data and technology to improve patient experiences and ultimately treatment outcomes. 

Watch the video here.

title: WLW Radio - Bill Cunningham and Dr. Gary Kirsh
description: Bill Cunningham interviews Dr. Gary Kirsh about IOASE legislation
body: Bill Cunningham interviews Dr. Gary Kirsh, President of The Urology Group, about federal legislation that would limit in-office procedures physicians can perform, potentially sending patients to hospitals at a higher cost. The two then discussed a wide range of urologic issues!

description: The Urology Group's Dr. Kevin Campbell discusses the Zika virus and other urological issues with 700 WLW's Bill Cunningham.
body:
Bill Cunningham of 700 WLW talks with The Urology Group's Dr. Kevin Campbell about the Zika virus, female urologists and prostate cancer treatments. 

Click the image to listen to the interview.

title: The Urology Group Among Independent Physicians to Share Electronic Records with Hospitals
description: Cincinnati’s hospitals and some of the largest independent doctor groups in the region plan to begin sharing electronic health records, which could lead to better medical outcomes for patients.
body: The Urology Group is among the members of the Independent Physician Collaborative who will soon implement a communications tool allowing them to better communicate with hospital-based physicians.

title: Business Courier - TriHealth/The Urology Group Agreement
description: TriHealth and The Urology Group have formalized an agreement to provide urological services to patients throughout the TriHealth system.
body: TriHealth and The Urology Group (TUG) have formalized an agreement to provide urological services to patients throughout the TriHealth system.  In addition to providing comprehensive urology services coverage, The Urology Group will provide medical-administrative leadership services, collaborate with TriHealth’s specialty Institutes for patient care programs, and work closely with TriHealth to improve the quality and coordination of our urology services.

title: VENUE Magazine - A Center of Excellence
description: The Urology Group is a prime example of how consolidation can be good for medical consumers.
body:
Since 1996, The Urology Group has provided medical and surgical care of the urinary tract for men and women at a mix of neighborhood offices and surgical care centers. Read more in the summer issue of VENUE Magazine. 

Click image to read full article.

title: Walz Named C-Suite Award Finalist

body:
Earl Walz is a Finalist for Cincinnati Business Courier's C-Suite Award

Earl Walz, CEO of The Urology Group, was named a finalist in a program that honors top Cincinnati executives. He is among 38 influential leaders named by the Cincinnati Business Courier. Winners will be announced at an awards program on August 25, 2016. 

Click to view list of all finalists.

title: Journal-News: Retirement not in Atrium Doctor's Future
description: Dr. David Miller, The Urology Group's Chief of Surgery, isn't quite ready to retire yet. Find out more about why he loves what he does and strives to deliver the best care in this Journal-News article.

description: LEAD Cincinnati reports about The Urology Group's mission and commitment to provide excellent urologic care to our community.

body:
Our very own Dr. Brian Shay was quoted in Glamour Magazine this month, talking about myths surrounding UTIs. He speaks openly about hygiene issues and how to reduce occurrence of urinary tract infections. 
 
Click image to read.

title: WLWT - Prostate Cancer Run - Ken Griffey, Sr.
description: Two men speak out on prostate cancer
body: Channel 5's Alexis Rogers interviews Paul Garland and Ken Griffey, Sr., both of whom have been diagnosed with prostate cancer. Both men spoke out at the Cincinnati ZERO prostate cancer run to promote early detection. The event was sponsored and hosted by The Urology Group for the 10th year in a row.

title: WKRC - ZERO Prostate Cancer Run This Weekend
description: Patient and physician promote upcoming Prostate Cancer 5k/10k event
body: Rob Cooper, patient of The Urology Group, and Dr. Philip Buffington talk about the importance of early screening for prostate cancer. Both men will attend the October 15 ZERO Prostate Cancer 5k/10k event at The Urology Group. The race kicks off a 9 a.m.

title: WCPO - Prostate Cancer Run
description: Cancer survivor encourages men to get checked
body: WCPO's Kristen Swilley talks with Paul Garland, a prostate cancer survivor. Mr. Garland says getting checked is the key to having options for treatment. The 10th annual race was sponsored by The Urology Group.

title: WCPO - Pearl Harbor Event

body: Army Air Corps veteran, Jay Solomon, shares his story of WWII with WCPO's Rose-Ann Aragon at The Urology Group's Pearl Harbor Day luncheon. The medical group sponsored the event to honor its patients who are WWII veterans.

title: WCPO - WWII Veteran Shares Experince
description: Morton Ballin shares his experience fighting after the attack on Pearl Harbor.
body: Army veteran, Morton Mallin, shares his story of WWII with WCPO's Rose-Ann Aragon at The Urology Group's Pearl Harbor Day luncheon. The medical group sponsored the event to honor its patients who are WWII veterans.

title: WKRC - Covers Pearl Harbor Event
description: WKRC's Megan Moore previews veteran event
body: Local 12 provides on-site coverage of The Urology Group's commemoration of the attack on Pearl Harbor at a luncheon in Sharonville.

title: WLWT’s Courtis Fuller Covers Veteran Event
description: Veterans Walter Kraus and Robert Watson share their WWII stories.
body: WLWT interviewed veterans Walter Kraus and Robert Watson at The Urology Group’s Pearl Harbor commemoration event. Watson was awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor as one of the first African-American Marines. Princeton High School students, Joey Noertker and Nick Dryden, talk about their “living history” project for WWII.

title: Enquirer - Pearl Harbor Day
description: The Urology Group recognizes 75 WWII veterans for Pearl Harbor milestone.

The Urology Group hosts 75 WWII veterans in commemoration of the attack on Pearl Harbor at a luncheon in Sharonville.  

Click to read full story.

title: WXIX Covers Pearl Harbor Event
description: Veterans Mike Kunnen and Jack Snyder talk about their WWII experiences.
body: FOX19's videographer, Dave Smith, interviews veterans Mike Kunnen and Jack Snyder about their WWII experiences at a luncheon sponsored by The Urology Group. The luncheon was organized to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor.

title: FOX News - Shockwave Therapy for ED
description: Dr. Kevin Campbell comments on a shockwave therapy for ED that could soon come to the U.S.
body: Dr. Kevin Campbell made national news with commentary on a shockwave therapy for ED that could soon come to the U.S. Studies show that the therapy may treat the disease itself, not just the symptoms.

title: Women's Health Magazine
description: Why you keep peeing your pants
body:
Ever feel a little bit of pee slip out when you didn’t plan on it? No need to blush—it happens to millions of women, and not just the ones in your grandma’s bridge circle. 
 
Did you know that 10.3 percent of women between the ages of 19 and 30 experience urinary incontinence (that’s the medical term for unintentional leakage).
 
Dr. Philip Buffington of The Urology Group speaks to women in this article from the June issue of Women’s Health magazine. 
 
Click here or on the image below to read the full article.

title: Business Courier - Dr. Edwards named CMO
description: Dr. Brooke Edwards is named chief medical officer.
body: Click to read story online.

title: WLW Radio - Prostate Cancer Testing Guidelines
description: Dr. Gary Kirsh, president of The Urology Group, talks with Bill Cunningham about the decision reversal regarding prostate cancer testing.
body: A government panel reversed its earlier decision about prostate cancer testing, suggesting now that early detection is key to preventing advanced prostate cancer, a position The Urology Group and other large urology practices across the country have long advocated.

title: Women's Health - Why Vasectomy?
description: It may surprise you why some men get vasectomies.
body:
Dr. Kevin Campbell gives recovery advice in an article that talks about the surprising reasons some men choose to get vasectomies. 

CLICK HERE FOR THE FULL ARTICLE IN WOMEN'S HEALTH MAGAZINE: http://www.womenshealthmag.com/sex-and-love/male-vasectomy

title: Cincinnati Business Courier Names Health Care Heroes
description: Dr. Karl Braun was named a 2017 Health Care Hero by the Business Courier
body: On Thursday, February 23, Dr. Karl Braun was named a winner in the Cincinnati Business Courier's 2017 Health Care Heroes award program. Dr. Braun was noted for his missionary work as well as his dedication to U.S. veterans.

title: Cincy Magazine - Independent Physicians
description: Dr. Gary Kirsh discusses advantages independent physician groups offer to patients.
body: The Urology Group was recently interviewed about its status (and preference) as one of the largest independent physician groups in the Tri-state. For patients, they offer better, cheaper and faster treatment options through highly specialized physicians and staff.

Dr. Eric Haaff talks with West Chester & Liberty Lifestyle editors about today's world of urology...signs to watch for and how common problems are treated. 
 
The Urology Group has 12 offices throughout the Tristate, including four in the West Chester, Middletown, Oxford and Fairfield areas. 
 
Click image below to read full article.

title: NKY Tribune - Free Cancer Screenings
description: Removing barriers to better health for first responders
body: The Urology Group offered free prostate cancer screenings for Northern Kentucky first responders. This was in direct response to a study that shows an increase in the rate of prostate cancer diagnosis among fire fighters. The screening was held at the Edgewood Fire House on April 26. Another is planned for the Independence Fire House in June.

title: Shape Magazine - Urine Color

Click image to read article.

http://www.shape.com/lifestyle/mind-and-body/what-urine-color-means-health

title: Enquirer - Dr. Malik UC Endowment
description: Dr. Malik spearheads $1mm gift to University of Cincinnati Islamic studies
body: The Urology Group's Dr. Inayat Malik, through the Islamic Center of Greater Cincinnati, is donating $1 million to the University of Cincinnati to increase understanding of the Islamic religion amid concerns about Islamophobia.

title: NKY Tribune - Immunotherapy Treatment
description: Drs. Gary Kirsh and Brooke Edwards share hopeful news for African Americans facing advanced prostate cancer
body:
Drs. Gary Kirsh and Brooke Edwards share hopeful news for African Americans facing advanced prostate cancer​. An FDA-approved immunotheraphy has been shown to provide additional overall survival benefit of 9.3 months for African-American men with advanced prostate cancer. 

Click here to read full article.

title: WCPO - Prostate Cancer
description: Dr. Gary Kirsh talks with WCPO about prostate cancer screening
body: In recognition of Prostate Cancer Awareness month, Dr. Gary Kirsh talks about the importance of screening as well as the change in mindset at the federal government about how often to test.

title: WCPO - Movember Shave Off 2017
description: Dr. Stephen Kappa talks about the importance of discussing men's health issues.
body:
Physicians and staff from The Urology Group marked the end of their Movember "Grow & Give" campaign to raise awareness of prostate cancer. The event took place at Listermann Brewing Co. with support from Dendron Pharmaceuticals. 

Dr. Stephen Kappa talked to the media about the importance of screening.

title: Are Bidets Making a Comeback?
description: There are considerations from health to environment when it comes to the use of bidets for hygiene.
body: Dr. Philip Buffington is quoted in this interesting article from The Guardian, the most popular UK newspaper website an 5th most popular in the world.

title: Kirsh testified before Ways and Means Committee
description: View Dr. Kirsh's testimony around modernizing the Stark Law.
body:
Dr. Gary Kirsh, president of The Urology Group, testified before Congress on July 27, 2018 on Modernizing Stark Law to ensure the successful transition in teh Medicare Program. 

Watch Dr. Kirsh's testimony on the link below. 

Here is a link to his opening remarks:  https://waysandmeans.house.gov/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/20180717HL-Kirsh-Testimony.pdf

The event, produced by The Urology Group, is Saturday, September 22 at Belterra Park and benefits ZERO - The End of Prostate Cancer.

title: Ohio Business Magazine - Honoring our Veterans
description: The Urology Group values relationships with veterans.

We at The Urology Group value all of our patient relationships. Admittedly, we have a soft spot for U.S. veterans and are proud of our history of sponsoring events that honor them.

title: HealthData Management - New EHR system
description: The Urology Group launches new electronic medical records system.
body: In an effort to improve patient communication and access to important healthcare information, The Urology Group is replacing its legacy electronic health records (EHR) system with a new and improved one.
